article_title: Mike Brost: Second Thoughts About Double Majors
article_text:
College freshmen are saying goodbye to their parents, moving into dorm rooms, exploring the quad for the first time and engaging in awkward small talk with new friends. Conversation doesn't last long before it lands on the question of the day: What's your major going to be?

For many, the right question should be: What are your majors? The 2003 National Survey of Recent College Graduates found that at elite universities an estimated one-in-three students major in more than one subject, and that a quarter of college...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Mike Brost asks what happened to studying, say, history and leaving it at that?
twitter.title: Second Thoughts About Double Majors
